result.markdown:
# Map of Tokyo List of R packages used in this section: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="false"} library(sf) library(tidyverse) library(jpndistrict) # to get the base map of Japan's prefecture library(ggthemes) # to use theme_map library(rnaturalearth) # to use ne_countries library(DT) # to produce data table ``` ::: - If you dont find japandistrict, use following: install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("uribo/jpndistrict") - Alternatively, you can use the `pacman` package manager to load necessary R packages from below: ::: {.cell} ```{.txt .cell-code} pacman::p_load(sf, tidyverse, jpndistrict, ggthemes, rnaturalearth) ``` ::: - Name the data world_map ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="false"} global_map <- ne_countries(scale = "small", returnclass = "sf") ``` ::: ## Population Map of Tokyo - The prefecture code for Tokyo is 13. Now we can plot the map of the 23 wards of Tokyo ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="false"} df_tokyo_sf <- jpn_pref(13, district = TRUE) %>% dplyr::filter(str_detect(city, "区")) ``` ::: - Display the extracted map of Tokyo's 23 wards ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="false"} df_tokyo_sf %>% ggplot() + geom_sf() + theme_minimal() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: - Check your data here ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="false"} head(df_tokyo_sf, 23) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Simple feature collection with 23 features and 4 fields Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON Dimension: XY Bounding box: xmin: 139.5636 ymin: 35.52086 xmax: 139.919 ymax: 35.81758 Geodetic CRS: WGS 84 # A tibble: 23 × 5 pref_code prefecture city_code city geometry 1 13 東京都 13101 千代田区 (((139.7299 35.68555, 139.7333 35.67… 2 13 東京都 13102 中央区 (((139.7589 35.65892, 139.7646 35.65… 3 13 東京都 13103 港区 (((139.7714 35.62304, 139.7825 35.62… 4 13 東京都 13104 新宿区 (((139.6735 35.71852, 139.679 35.718… 5 13 東京都 13105 文京区 (((139.7174 35.71455, 139.7232 35.71… 6 13 東京都 13106 台東区 (((139.7632 35.72184, 139.7685 35.71… 7 13 東京都 13107 墨田区 (((139.8095 35.68689, 139.812 35.688… 8 13 東京都 13108 江東区 (((139.7715 35.61667, 139.7712 35.61… 9 13 東京都 13109 品川区 (((139.6954 35.60832, 139.6957 35.61… 10 13 東京都 13110 目黒区 (((139.6664 35.61861, 139.6631 35.61… # ℹ 13 more rows ``` ::: ::: - Import the .CSV data to make an interactive population map of Tokyo ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="false"} df_tokyo_pop <- read_csv("data/csv/tokyo_pop.csv") datatable(df_tokyo_pop) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: - Merge the spatial data with your population data ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="false"} merge_tokyo <- df_tokyo_sf %>% left_join(df_tokyo_pop, by = "city") %>% st_as_sf() ``` ::: - Check the merged data ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="false"} merge_tokyo %>% head() %>% rmarkdown::paged_table() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
````` ::: ::: - Plot your data with ggplot2 ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="false"} map_pop_tokyo <- merge_tokyo %>% ggplot() + geom_sf(aes(fill = population)) + scale_fill_distiller(name = "Population", palette = "Greens", direction = 1) + theme_map(base_family = "HiraginoSans-W3") + theme(legend.position = c(.1, -.1), legend.direction = "horizontal", legend.title = element_text(size = 15), legend.text = element_text(size = 15), legend.key.size = unit(1, "cm"), legend.key.width = unit(3,"cm")) + coord_sf(datum = NA) map_pop_tokyo ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![Population of Tokyo, Japan](lecture_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: - Plot your population data with the name of the cities in Tokyo ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="false"} map_pop_tokyo_text <- merge_tokyo %>% mutate( text_x = map_dbl(geometry, ~st_centroid(.x)[[1]]), text_y = map_dbl(geometry, ~st_centroid(.x)[[2]]) ) %>% ggplot() + geom_sf(aes(fill = population)) + geom_label(aes(x = text_x, y = text_y, label = city), size = 1.7, family = "HiraginoSans-W3") + scale_fill_distiller(name = "Population", palette = "Greens", direction = 1) + theme_map(base_family = "HiraginoSans-W3") + theme(legend.position = c(.8, .05), legend.title = element_text(size = 10), legend.text = element_text(size = 5), legend.key.size = unit(0.5, "cm"), legend.key.width = unit(1,"cm")) + coord_sf(datum = NA) map_pop_tokyo_text ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![Population of Tokyo, Japan](lecture_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: - To export the above figure, use the following code: ::: {.cell} ```{.txt .cell-code} ggsave("fig/map_pop_tokyo_text.png", map_pop_tokyo_text, width = 13, height = 13) ``` :::
